ai.summary: The Mount Stewart Red Trail is a 3.6 km easy loop on the Mount Stewart estate in the UK. It suits families and casual walkers, with well-marked paths and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of compacted earth, gravel and grassy sections with gentle gradients. Expect well-maintained trails and occasional steps near garden areas; footing can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and trail conditions before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and layer clothing for changing conditions. Stay on marked paths; watch for uneven ground, mud, and other hikers. Carry water and snacks; supervise children and pets. Mobile reception may be limited in rural parts—carry a map or offline navigation. Respect estate guidelines and any closures.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to September) offer the best weather and scenery; the hike can be done year-round with proper gear.
